explanation: Performs a TCP SYN knock sequence to three high-numbered ports using netcat's zero-I/O scan mode (-z). This acts as a signaling mechanism to trigger a hidden rule change on the device. No admin rights are needed to send SYNs. Detection: alert on repeated short-lived TCP connection attempts to closed ports in a specific order.
rationale_steps: Transmit SYN probes to a predefined set of ports in order.
Leverage a hidden listener to recognize the ordered sequence.
Upon recognition, the device may open another service port.
Detection: use firewall logs/NetFlow to correlate ordered SYN attempts to uncommon ports.
